intro: [WRONG START] Geranium rotundifolium var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered geranium, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features rounded, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening.
